intro: Microstylis macrostachya, commonly known as the broad-stalked microstylis, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family, Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist, nutrient-rich soils. Microstylis macrostachya is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the ecological diversity of these habitats.
